subject: JUnit: How to disable printing dots "." on console ?
msgSnippet: Hi all, I have a doubt/difficulty in JUnit to handle.. Junit prints a dot . on the screen as soon as it runs a test successfully. Is there a way to disable
messageBody:
Hi all,

I have a doubt/difficulty in JUnit to handle..

Junit prints a dot "." on the screen as soon as it runs a test
successfully. Is there a way to disable this feature ? I want no dots
to be printed on the console..

JUnit also prints a "F" or an "E" if it encounters failures or
run-time errors.. Although I would like to disable these as well.. I
would first like to deal with the "." 's..

Thanks in advance,
Mahendra.
